author: jih2nn
content: Thanks for the notes! Is the IL means FOCIL or something else?

author: etan_status
content: we can just update the protocol to sign over the next fork version as well once that becomes the last hurdle. today, with SSZ data structures not being forward compatible, it's pointless to add the fork version signature. it's a bit tricky as that signature has to be made during the old fork still, but doable

author: etan_status
content: the one change that still requires client updates that is unavoidable is if stuff changes that the client actually cares about. e.g., hash function change is disruptive to everyone. but what the forward stability ensures is that as long as the stuff doesn't semantically change that the client cares about, it will continue to work ðŸ™‚ fewer updates, fewer maintenance on the side of app developers (many), vs extra complexity, more rigorous awareness about compatibility on the side of core developers (few)

author: etan_status
content: forward compatibility was btw explored for electra scope, but there's too much other stuff, and it got cut for pectra. smart contract devs consuming beacon data were mostly affected by the other changes as well, as they mostly represented staking pools (need to adjust for consolidations) or block explorers (need to adjust for new attestations and new formats on an exhaustive level)

author: etan_status
content: it will be re-explored as part of a broader <#1295427781722898505> scope on https://purified-web3.box where transactions / receipts are also migrated to SSZ to enable proofs of partial calldata / logdata, and also to enable efficient lookups and verifiable proofs on `eth_getLogs` which is one limitation also for portal network today.

author: etan_status
content: All of these changes benefit light clients, it makes more sense to group them up instead of shipping them one by one.
